intro: Cacalia tepicana, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its blue to purple flower heads are composed of numerous small florets, and it has hairy stems and leaves. Cacalia tepicana is often found in open fields and along roadsides, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
